episode_summary: This episode of "No Such Thing As A Fish" covers a range of quirky and intriguing facts, including the surprising amount of gold flushed down Swiss toilets, Robert Burns' unique ink recipe, the shifting heights of Sweden's highest peaks due to melting glaciers, and the origin of the town name Modesto in California.

facts.fact: The Swiss flush about $2 million worth of gold down the toilet every year.
Robert Burns made his own ink out of old beer, lard, elephant tusk, and sulfuric acid.
Sweden's highest point is now its second highest after the top of it melted.
When financier William C. Ralston modestly refused to allow a town to be named after him, the town instead called itself Modesto.
